channel.title: Any way to stop ipswitchers?
channel.description:
Hello,
If i ipban some1, they sometimes use a ipswitcher. I hate it realy realy much. Is there anyway to fix this?
Thanks, I D D S I

item.title: Any way to stop ipswitchers?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“I D D S I, post:1, topic:267845”]Hello,

If i ipban some1, they sometimes use a ipswitcher.
I hate it realy realy much. Is there anyway to fix this?

Thanks, I D D S I[/quote]

Do these “ipSwitcher’s” change the users hostname? If not you can block there hostname.

Read full topic

item.title: Any way to stop ipswitchers?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“rash, post:13, topic:267845”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=353604.msg2709946#msg2709946 date=1237242580]

There is no way to fix this. The best possible way I see is to block that IP.

If my IP was 11111@optonline.net and I change it to 11112@optonline.net, I can log in.

In your client class, you can block me by saying -

if(connectedFrom.endsWith("optonline.net")) { disconnected = true;

They can still log in, but they will be disconnected automatically.

that means anyone using that service provider would be blocked…

That’s kind of obvious. Well, that means you lose about 5% of your players. Big deal.

But is it worth it just to prevent one player from breaking the rules?
[/quote]

lose 5 because of one?

HmMM?[/quote]
5%, not even. More like 2%. For every 100 players, you lose 2. Not bad.

Read full topic

If my IP was 11111@optonline.net and I change it to 11112@optonline.net, I can log in.

In your client class, you can block me by saying -

if(connectedFrom.endsWith("optonline.net")) { disconnected = true;

They can still log in, but they will be disconnected automatically.

that means anyone using that service provider would be blocked…

That’s kind of obvious. Well, that means you lose about 5% of your players. Big deal.

But is it worth it just to prevent one player from breaking the rules?[/quote]

HmMM?

Well, I can’t think of any other possible way to block an IP? Got any ideas?

item.title: Any way to stop ipswitchers?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

It won’t lag. It’s only disconnecting the player.

Read full topic

item.title: Any way to stop ipswitchers?
item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:4, topic:267845”]In your client class, search for -

public void run()

Then, add -

if(connectedFrom.endsWith("THE END OF THE IP")) { disconnected = true; }[/quote]

Nice, it is a way, but isnt this gonna lagg?
Because if u login 1time, u come black screen connection lost i go to server, it says 30x, player blabla dissconnect, sure its not gonna lag?

Read full topic

item.title: Any way to stop ipswitchers?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

In your client class, search for -

public void run()

Then, add -

if(connectedFrom.endsWith("THE END OF THE IP")) { disconnected = true; }

Read full topic

i searched : if(connectedFrom.endsWith
didnt find anything please help me more:)
